detaileddescription.para: The Zephyr OS is a small-footprint kernel designed for use on resource-constrained and embedded systems: from simple embedded environmental sensors and LED wearables to sophisticated embedded controllers, smart watches, and IoT wireless applications.
See the zephyrproject.org site for more information about the project and becoming a member, and this summary of Zephyr resources to help you find your way around the project.

sect1.title: Supported Boards
sect1.para: The Zephyr kernel supports multiple architectures, including ARM Cortex-M, Intel x86, ARC, NIOS II, Tensilica Xtensa, and RISC-V 32. For details, see the latest supported boards documentation.
